We have the monotonicity of $L^p$ norms on a probability space: if $p \ge q$, then $\|f\|_p \le \|f\|_q$.

```{python}
# a tiny numerical check
import numpy as np
rng = np.random.default_rng(0)
x = rng.standard_normal(10_000)
p, q = 4, 2
lhs = (np.mean(np.abs(x)**p))**(1/p)
rhs = (np.mean(np.abs(x)**q))**(1/q)
float(lhs), float(rhs), lhs <= rhs
```

A citation example @barenblatt1952 shows how references appear. See the source of this post for details.
